articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Evacuation of foreigners from Wuhan hastening spread of virus?
articles.description: Health expert says countries are justified in ordering evacuations as they are looking after welfare of their citizens.
articles.content:
The spread of coronavirus in China has shown no signs of slowing down, as the number of deaths hits 212, and confirmed infections across the country reaches 8,124 as of Friday.
With the city of Wuhan and the greater province of Hubei remaining under lockdown… [+5873 chars]

articles.title: WHO declares coronavirus global emergency as death toll rises
articles.description: China's health commission says the number of confirmed coronavirus cases rose to 9,692 with at least 213 deaths.
articles.content:
The World Health Organization declared the outbreak sparked by coronavirus in China as a global emergency on Thursday, after the number of cases spiked more than tenfold in a week, while the death toll rose to 213.

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: WHO calls for science and solidarity over Coronavirus
articles.description: Global health leaders agree Coronavirus is a global emergency, but said China travel bans were not based in science.
articles.content:
The coronavirus outbreak is a global health emergency, the director-general of the World Health Organization has declared - but added that travel restrictions to China would be counterproductive.
An "unprecedented outbreak" had been met with an "unprecedente… [+4760 chars]

articles.title: US reports its first case of person-to-person spread of new virus
articles.description: New patient is spouse of a Illinois woman who had been infected while visiting Wuhan, China, the epicentre of outbreak.
articles.content:
US health officials on Thursday reported the first case of person-to-person spread of the novel coronavirus in the United States.

articles.title: S Korea officials face anger over coronavirus quarantine centres
articles.description: Protesters rage over plans to quarantine hundreds of Koreans set to be flown home from China's coronavirus epicentre.
articles.content:
Angry South Koreans volleyed eggs and expletives on Thursday at a minister and officials trying to defuse their ire over plans to quarantine hundreds of citizens set to be flown home from the epicentre of a new coronavirus epidemic in China.

articles.title: Coronavirus: 6,000 tourists in lockdown on Italian cruise ship
articles.description: Ship held in quarantine over suspected case of the deadly virus, after doctors tend to woman from Macau running a fever.
articles.content:
More than 6,000 tourists have been put on lockdown on a cruise ship in Italy on Thursday after a suspected case of coronavirus was detected on board the vast liner.

articles.title: Hong Kong braces for spread of coronavirus
articles.description: Coronavirus outbreak, which has killed 170 people and infected thousands across mainland China, has now spread to every part of the country.

articles.title: China virus toll hits 170, as countries step up evacuation plans
articles.description: The coronavirus outbreak started in Wuhan in December and has now reached every corner of China.

articles.description: Overseas students in city at centre of outbreak are confined to dormitories, hoping to avoid coronavirus infection.
articles.content:

articles.title: China battles coronavirus outbreak: All the latest updates
articles.description: Death toll jumps again, infections accelerate while airlines cut flights and businesses suspend operations.
articles.content:
The death toll in China from a deadly new coronavirus rose to 170, state media said on Thursday, with the worst-hit province of Hubei reporting 37 fatalities.
